ordain verb
(CHURCH)
[ T often passive ] to officially make someone a priest or other religious leader, in a religious ceremony: He was ordained (as) a priest in Ely cathedral in 1987.

ordain verb
(ORDER)
[ T ] formal (of God or someone in authority) to order something to happen: There is strong support here for the tough economic reforms ordained in the federal capital, Prague. [ + that ] humorous I don't know who came up with the idea, but the city council has ordained that all the local libraries will close on Mondays.
